curriculum_stages.name: Beginner - Hit or Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Learn the basic rules of Blackjack and how to choose between hitting and standing based on your hand and the dealer's upcard. Focus on learning when to hit (low total, dealer showing a strong card) and when to stand (high total, dealer showing a weak card).

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced Beginner - Introducing Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Double Down' action. Learn when doubling down is advantageous (e.g., hard 11, hard 10 vs. dealer 9 or less). Mastering this action will significantly improve the agent's win rate.

curriculum_stages.name: Intermediate - Splitting Pairs
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Split' action. Learn the optimal strategy for splitting pairs (e.g., always split Aces and 8s, never split 5s or 10s). This stage requires the agent to understand conditional probabilities better.

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced - Early Surrender
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Early Surrender' action. Learn when surrendering is the mathematically correct choice (e.g., hard 16 vs. dealer 9, 10, or Ace in some rule variations). This requires a deep understanding of negative expected value scenarios.

curriculum_stages.name: Expert - Mastering Insurance
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Insurance' action. Understand the conditions under which taking insurance might be beneficial (e.g., counting cards or having a high concentration of tens in your hand). This stage requires advanced reasoning and memory.
